> [{quoted}](name=T34M5RH34VY,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VrRovT6V,comment-id=00050000000000000000,timestamp=2018-01-21T01:06:20.797+0000)

Vayne will always be overpowered as long as she has that kit. There are not enough number nerfs in the world that you could give to make her balanced and still playable; like Yasuo. To make her balanced and fair, you would have to rework her. She is one of the first pure cancer champs conceived. She is the Riven of marksmen and that is not a good thing.

How would you rework her though?

The "problem" that everyone is referring to in her kit is her true damage......unfortunately, this 1 thing is her entire identity. She is the definitive "tank slayer", meant to churn down tanks faster than any other ADC.

Take a look back at every other VGU Riot has done......they have been able to keep the identity of every champ, but fix the problems the champ had. In Vayne's case, her identity *is* the problem. You either need to come up with some very clever way to keep her identity, or make a completely new champion.

And if you say that VGU champs *are* new champions, an *identity* is different from a *theme*......at least in a game development standpoint. Galio's *identity* is a magic absorbing tank, that can turn said magic against you. His *theme* changed from a broken, forgotten statue, to basically a Demacian Superhero. Get what I'm saying?

I would probably push her even more towards the tank shredder. Buff her silvers bolts, but do one of the following
* Remove damage on Q making it primarily a repositioning spell. Maybe let it give a VERY short AS steroid with a slightly longer CD.
* Remove the bonus AD on her ult

Both of these changes would help eliminate a huge amount of that up front burst she can do. But at the same time, I think Rageblade vayne is the most balanced.

But then you run into the problem of her being completely unstoppable in the top lane, at least in the laning phase.....and we all know how much people feel about top lane right now.....*especially* when Vayne goes up there.

She would become the next Teemo or Quinn; being able to shut down tanks or juggernauts just fine in lane, but not being able to compete with any other marksman in the game. Than come mid to late, to where teamfights start happening, she becomes completely useless except to help shred down the front line.

This is what happens when a champs identity becomes the problem. If you go too hard into that identity, you make the champ far too niche. If you don't, than you end up with Mordekaiser.

That's fair; however I think you could fix some of that by reworking her e/ removing it.

You take away her hard CC, and some of her bonus burst damage and you get someone that you can potentially stick onto as a top laner.

So you want Vayne to have, no hard CC, a below average repositioning spell, and no AA steroids besides a minor AS buff? 

Sorry why would I ever pick this ADC?
To shred tanks with consistent %max hp true damage.

Kog does pretty much the same with a 1/2 item spike and he doesn't even have to position himself correctly, just fire away. So Vayne wouldn't really be an ideal of a pick even there, if you need more skill to play her like Kog, whereas Kog is better than her in any regard due to his AS steroids and W that actually shreds tanks without having to apply a 3-hit passive on them.
Guess what kog is toxic and overpowered as well. Gut him until he gets reworked.

Except that kogmaw gets blocked pretty hard by adaptive helm. There is no counter to vaynes % max hp TRUE damage.

You sacrifice long range with no mobility magic damage for short range mid-high mobility true damage. That sounds pretty good to me.

So then wouldn't it be better to just rework her E, and remove the extra AD she gets on her ult?

Her ult already alters her Q, so, as compensation for removing the AD (which is pretty massive) whatever this new E will be, her ult could alter that as well.

Nooooooooo. riot buffed her silver bolts and look what happened. % Health True damage will never ever ever be balanced because there is no counter at all to it. If anything to make her a propper tank shredder make it deal damage equal to the enemies armor lol.

> [{quoted}](name=Sp33d Zer0,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VrRovT6V,comment-id=00050000000000000001,timestamp=2018-01-21T03:01:37.574+0000)

Not enough. She should never have above a 48% win rate EVER. I would go as far as saying she shouldn't have anything above 45%. But I just hate her, so If i never had to see that POS champ again I would be happy. Same with Gnar.
So because you have a massive bias against the champion, a 4% win rate is not enough of a drop, and having anything above 48% win rate means she is imbalanced?

The point he's making, and you're failing to understand, is that her win rate, like all "high skill" champions, should *never* be 50% or higher. 

If a "high skill" champion has a win rate higher than 50%, it is almost *always* because they are overpowered or overtuned.

You cannot have a champion with an "above average skill requirement" that has an "above average win rate".
The simple fact of their above average skill requirement means that for over 50% of players, they should be too difficult to win consistently with, thus lowering the win rate to below 50%. There's really no way around this.

That's the point he's making. He even followed up by adding that due to their bias they believe it should be even lower than 48%, but they're entirely correct: No "high skill" champion should have a winrate outside the 45-48% range, because if it is higher than 48%, it is almost a guarantee something about them is overpowered at that time.

Aurelion Sol is an incredibly high skill cap champion who is only truly balanced if he's at around a 52-53% win rate.

Pick rate matters a ton on high skill cap champions. If a character has a high pick rate with a high win rate, you know it's a problem. A high win rate with a low pick rate on a high mechanical champion means that the successful one tricks are wrecking which is how it SHOULD be.

Well, it´s just that the "effective range" argument is complete bs outside out laning phase, and even there long range poke lost a lot of value since early sustain is so easily available. In fact, it rather supports the idea of vayne being a noob-friendly adc, because the problem i see with many bad adcs is, that they never commit to a fight. Being the main dps role in the game, there comes a point in the fight, where you just have to go in and hope that your support/team peels for you, but many adcs with long effective range simply won´t do that, because they are too busy sitting in the backline tickling the enemy with their qs.

so what would I rather have when my adc is inexperienced? An adc like varus that will most certainly miss his ult (skillshot), won´t commit to a fight and stay back trying to hit his q (also skillshot) or an adc like vayne that can´t wait to jump into 5 people (because they are all a bunch of monkeys trying to get pentas) and just has to keep auto-attacking, since her only skillshot does not even contribute to her dps, while she get shielded and healed and is also invisible half the time. 

And maybe she overcommits and dies, that happens. But compared to other adcs, who have skillshot or gimmicks that an inexperienced player can fuck up or an experienced enemy can abuse, vayne will have put out way more dps and contributed to the fight a hell of a lot more than any of them, because of how foolproof her kit actually is and how it rewards you for playing hyper-aggressive.

people still memorize vayne as this high skill ceiling adc, who gets bullied early and has to scale. Who has a tough time in teamfights due to her single target dmg, but all these issues have been solved a long time ago. You don´t have to suffer through a terrible laning phase, when sustain is everywhere and your counters are nowhere to be found. You don´t have to worry about scaling, when lategame begins at 20mins and all your items are buffed and made cheaper and you don´t have to worry about single target dmg when teamfights only last 4 seconds and everyone is one-shotting each other.

Enemy team being monkeys is not a valid reason why Vayne is strong.
If Vayne's playstyle dictates that she has to go in and fight while other Marksmen do not (because of the lack of escapes and maneuverability), it stands to reason that Vayne cannot succeed in poking people due to her power all being in her AAs and a steroid ult while others can work with poking first.
Yes, and writing effective range you failed to take into account the other things in Vayne's kit that justify the 550 range AND help her mitigate it.

After years of being told Vayne requires high mechanical depth to do well with, when I got on the PBE and tried her out myself I found out that there are alot of lying Vayne mains out there. Granted Gosu is amazing with her and other champions but you don't have to be a master at dodging to blow up your enemies with Vayne.

Her only ability with any actual depth is her Q and that is a small puddle were talking about here. Her W is a passive, her E you use in specific situation like when an enemy is near a wall or you want them away form you and her ult is just a steroid. Usable in the literally every situation she's in. Even her passive is incredibly basic which is "Run at enemies faster!"

Her level of "skill" is probably the lowest of any ADC since her only real flaw is her range, which is even still an advantage against melee champions which is half the roster. Not to mention Quinn also faces the issue of range and you don't see people giving her praise for being a dangerous CQC fighter despite the fact she literally flies into her enemies with 2 of her abilities.

At this point it's just a myth how "hard" adcs are to play. 
Two years of constant powercreep and there is no difficulty behind it anymore. 
A few seasons ago when adcs REALLY got oneshot by everyone and their mother yes. 
Now? Tell me how hard it is geting twice your health bar in shields and healing standing in front of a camille just rightclicking her to death in melee range. 
Same for jax and anyone else if not ridiculously fed.
